TopicTitle: Why do people say the moon is made of cheese?

Articles.Content: Clearly, the only thing in our solar system made of cheese is Io. It even has mould. But to say that the moon is made of cheese... ridiculous.

...It isn't?

...

...

What are these lies you speak?

NOooooo...........

My Space Program now has no point.
Because it looks yellow sometimes.

It is made of cheese! what is your issue Kerbface?

It's so blatantly obvious:)
If your conditions for something being made from cheese involves mold, then wouldn't Earth be cheese since there is a lot of mold?
Because ancient people were very hungry, so hungry that they had hallucinations of a big cheese ball in the sky. ( Even though they hadn't invented it at that time, it just sounded like a good idea)

If your conditions for something being made from cheese involves mold, then wouldn't Earth be cheese since there is a lot of mold?

Nope, the fact that you can see mold on it's obviously cheesy surface is simply further proof of something I already knew.
But the moon is cheese, otherwise why would we go there?
Because humanity has the intellect of soup. The End
But wouldn't the Mooncheese go great with the Laythecrab soup?
Maybe because the Moon and Swiss Cheese both look similar?

Maybe because the Moon and Swiss Cheese both look similar?

No, because swiss has holes via bacteria. and the Moon cannot support a bacterial colony and therefore is a completely different type of cheese: Mooncheese. Or in KSP: MÃƒÂ¼ncheese
Because the moon looks like a big wheel of swiss cheese.

ITS NOT SWISS. It is not holy enough to be swiss and cannot support the bacteria needed.

IT IS MOONCHEESE

Because the moon looks like a big wheel of swiss cheese.

Nonsense. Swiss cheese wheels look nothing like the Earth moon.
